lohud.com  (WEB - en-US)

Lohud.com is the website of The Journal News, a New York newspaper that serves the Lower Hudson Valley area, including the counties just north of New York City.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

Lohud.com is owned by Gannett Company Inc., a publicly traded company that owns more than 100 news organizations around the country, including its flagship publication USA Today. Those news sites make up the USA Today Network, which Gannett formed in 2015. Gannett publications generate revenue through advertisements and subscriptions for their printed publications, websites, and other digital products.

Gannett-owned publications have won numerous awards, including three Pulitzer Prizes in 2018.

Content

Lohud.com covers news in Westchester, Rockland, and Putnam counties in New York, as well as lifestyle topics including health and dining. The navigation bar links prominently to the USA Today website. Content on lohud.com is a blend of local reporting and stories written by other USA Today network sites.

Credibility

Articles on the site are mostly produced by staff journalists and are balanced and well-sourced. Headlines accurately reflect the content of articles.

Lohud.com links to the USA Today Network Principles of Ethical Conduct for Newsrooms, which state a commitment to be fair and accurate and to publish needed corrections promptly. The site runs corrections and clarifications to stories containing errors, and notes changes at the top of each updated article.

The site publishes opinion pieces, editorials, and letters in a separate section.

Transparency

Lohud.com posts a list of editors and reporters organized by section, and includes headshots and contact information. There is also a Contact Us page containing a comments form and phone numbers for Journal News departments, including the newsroom. Articles include the name of the reporter and the newspaper where they work. The site discloses its ownership by Gannett.

Lohud.com labels its ads and sponsored content.

History

The Journal News and its predecessors have been operating for 150 years. Eleven local newspapers merged in 1998 to form the contemporary version of The Journal News.

In December 2012, The Journal News published a story about the availability of information about gun ownership in the area. Lohud.com published an interactive map with the story, which used public records to pinpoint the locations of handgun permit holders and allowed readers to see their names and addresses. In response to threats and public outrage, the newspaper hired armed security guards and a few weeks later removed the database from its website.
